page.title: 14A junior member: Glenalmond
page.content: John Carnegie, 13 years old, studies:{ {Mathematics, English, History, {Geography, French, Latin, Science, Art {and Divinity.} In his spare time he mostly goes swimming or does some other sport. He enjoys boarding school as most of the time there is a lot to do. As a second former he believes that his work is easy . The relationship between junior and senior boys is good but the juniors feel that some are too 'fascist'. He feels that the running of the school should be modernised, as should the buildings, e.g. the Science block. The major disadvantage of a junior boy is the labour and fagging that must be done. This boy hopes that the Labour Party will not abolish public schools, should they gain power.
